visual.name: deneb
visual.description: Use the Vega or Vega-Lite languages to create bespoke visuals, directly inside Power BI.

en-US.Roles_Drilldown_Description:
To ensure that Deneb correctly knows about which columns are being used to drill-down on, add them (or a hierarchy) to this role.

𝗡𝗢𝗧𝗘: This will modify the grain of your dataset to match the current drilldown context.
en-US.Objects_Developer_Description: Options used for development of the visual.
en-US.Objects_Developer_Version_Description: Last version of Deneb used when editing this specification. Can be used to track when a new version alert might be needed.
en-US.Objects_Developer_Locale_Description: Provide a manual locale for the visual (to facilitate testing of i18n and formatting)
en-US.Objects_Display_Description: Options used to manage visual display.
en-US.Objects_Display_ScrollbarColor_Descripti: Color to shade the scrollbars (if displayed).
en-US.Objects_Display_ScrollbarRadius_Descript: Border radius of the scrollbars (if displayed).
en-US.Objects_Display_ScrollEventThrottle_Desc: In order to prevent scroll events from updating the Vega view more than necessary, this property allows you to specify a throttle time (in milliseconds) to prevent this.
en-US.Objects_StateManagement_Description: Options used to manage the state of the visual.
en-US.Objects_StateManagement_ViewportHeight_D: Persisted viewport height (as per last eligible update).
en-US.Objects_StateManagement_ViewportWidth_De: Persisted viewport width (as per last eligible update).
en-US.Objects_Vega_Description: Properties that manage the supplied source code for the visual.
en-US.Objects_Vega_JsonSpec_Description: Contains the generated or coded JSON specification.
en-US.Objects_Vega_Config_Description: Contains the generated or coded JSON config.
en-US.Objects_Vega_Provider_Description: Specify the provider to render your visual specification.
en-US.Objects_Vega_Version_Description: Last version of Vega/Vega-Lite (depending on provider) used when editing this specification. Can be used to track when a new version alert might be needed or if there might be incompatibilities.
en-US.Objects_Vega_LogLevel_Description: Level of logging to use when inspecting runtime issues.
en-US.Objects_Vega_RenderMode_Description: Specify how to render the generated visual in the page. Canvas is better for performance at the trade-off of interactivity.
en-US.Objects_Vega_EditorMode_Description: The preferred mode to open the editor in, by default.
en-US.Objects_Vega_EnableContextMenu: Resolve data points in context menu
en-US.Objects_Vega_EnableSelection: Expose cross-filtering values for dataset rows
en-US.Objects_Vega_SelectionMode_Description: Specify how to handle selection of data points in the visual.
en-US.Objects_Vega_SelectionMaxDataPoints_Desc: It is possible for a single mark to be layered many times if your data dictates it. If such a mark is clicked, this can result in Power BI attempting to cross-filter more data points than is sensible and can have negative performance impacts on your report. This allows you to specify where this line should be drawn and if this value is exceeded, then Deneb will display a warning message to your readers.
en-US.Objects_Vega_TooltipDelay_Description: How long to defer display of tooltip for, if the user is holding the ctrl key when hovering.
en-US.Objects_Editor_Theme_Description: The theme to apply to the editor interface.
en-US.Objects_Editor_Description: Customise aspects of the visual editor
en-US.Objects_Editor_Position_Description: Specify which side of the interface to place the editor.
en-US.Objects_Editor_FontSize_Description: Sets the JSON editor font size (in pt).
en-US.Objects_Editor_WordWrap_Description: Wrap lines that overflow the editor width rather than needing to scroll to read them.
en-US.Objects_Editor_ShowLineNumbers_Descripti: Display line numbers in the gutter.
en-US.Objects_Editor_ShowViewportMarker_Descri:
When enabled, this will show the boundary (viewport) of your visual prior to opening the editor. You can use this to determine if your design will fit within the boundary

𝗡𝗢𝗧𝗘: is not possible to programmatically resize the viewport, so if you wish to change the size, you'll need to return to report view, modify and then re-open the Advanced Editor.
en-US.Objects_Editor_PreviewScrollbars_Descrip: If this is set, scrollbars will be displayed in the Preview Area if the visual content overflows the container. This can be used to further erify how your visual will render on the canvas.
en-US.Objects_Editor_BackgroundPassThrough: Apply background settings to preview area
en-US.Objects_Editor_BackgroundPassThrough_Des: If this is set, the theme will be ignored and try to resolve the background color applied to the visual container in the Preview Area.
en-US.Objects_Editor_DebugTableRowsPerPage_Des: The number of rows to show in the Data and Signals tables in the debug pane.
en-US.Objects_Editor_DebouncePeriod_Descriptio: The interval at which to process change events in the editor. You can increase this to a longer interval if experiencing performance issues.
en-US.Objects_Theme_Description: Customise aspects of report theme integration with the Vega view.
en-US.Objects_Theme_OrdinalColorCount_Descript: The amount of colors you might need in an ordinal series might vary based on how many discrete values you have. This property allows you to manually specify the number of interval colors to calculate before "wrapping" back to the first, or apply a measure to calcuate this for you.
en-US.Objects_DataLimit_Description:
By default, custom visuals can display a maximum of 30,000 rows. If you have more than this in the data you want to visualise, then these options allow you to override the default limit 𝗮𝘁 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗰𝗼𝘀𝘁 𝗼𝗳 𝗽𝗲𝗿𝗳𝗼𝗿𝗺𝗮𝗻𝗰𝗲.

𝗡𝗢𝗧𝗘: anything that updates the visual (data, properties) can be costly. If you are making interim changes to your visual, it is recommended that you turn these options off while doing that, and re-enable them when you're finished.
en-US.Objects_DataLimit_Override_Description:
Allow loading of additional data from the model to the visual, if it is available.

Note that Power BI still may not be able to supply all data to your visual, depending on memory constraints.
en-US.Objects_DataLimit_ShowProgress_Descripti: Display information and explanation when fetching more data from the model if the row limit is exceeded.
en-US.Objects_DataLimit_ShowCustomVisualNotes_:
Display information about the custom visual limitations and recommendations for end users.

This option allows you to turn this info off for end-users if you feel it is not relevant to them.
en-US.Alert_Invalid_Grammar_Provider: An invalid or unsupported grammar provider has been specified. Please resolve this.
en-US.Info_No_Spec_Or_Data: There is no data in the visual, or a valid specification has not been provided.
en-US.Button_Help: Open help site in a new tab [Ctrl+Alt+H]
en-US.Button_Export_Dirty: Save your changes first to ensure that your specification is eligible for export.
en-US.Button_Theme_Dark: Switch between dark and light mode (currently dark mode) [Ctrl+Shift+Alt+T]
en-US.Button_Theme_Light: Switch between dark and light mode (currently light mode) [Ctrl+Shift+Alt+T]
en-US.Button_ZoomFit: Zoom preview to fit available space [Ctrl+Alt+*]
en-US.Editor_Assistive: Use the editor and tools below to edit your visual's specification.
en-US.Spec_Error_Overview: Your specification contains an error - the details we got from the compiler are as follows:
en-US.Spec_Error_More: More information may be available in the {0} pane below.
en-US.Fetching_Data_Progress_Suffix: row(s) loaded from data model so far...
en-US.Fetching_Data_Assitive_01_Prefix: You're seeing this section because you've enabled the
en-US.Fetching_Data_Assitive_01_Suffix: property. There are some important things to note if you're intending to use this in your reports. The following events will trigger a reload, which may affect performance and make editing more cumbersome:
en-US.Fetching_Data_Assitive_02_Point_01: Adding/removing columns & measures, and slicing data into the visual.
en-US.Fetching_Data_Assitive_02_Suffix: As such, you may wish to disable this property if you're doing a lot of editing and then re-enable when ready to test and publish.
en-US.Fetching_Data_Assitive_03_Prefix: You can prevent this message being displayed for your end-users by turning off the
en-US.Apply_Unsynced: Remember to apply changes before exiting!
en-US.CommandBar_Aria_Label: Use left and right arrow keys to navigate between commands.
en-US.Fix_Failed_Suffix: Please check the appropriate editor error details to correct, and try again.
en-US.Assistive_Text_Provider: Vega-Lite is a much more concise syntax for creating common visualizations, and is simpler for newcomers. It is recommended to start with Vega-Lite first, and then switch to Vega if you need more advanced functionality.
en-US.Assistive_Text_RenderMode: Specify how visuals should be rendered when processed. Canvas creates pixel graphics and SVG creates vector graphics. It is recommended to use Canvas if your visual needs to render many data points or marks, as this can reduce overhead on devices viewing the visual.
en-US.Assistive_Text_Interactivity: Please note that interactivity options may require further configuration via your specification once enabled.
en-US.Export_Spec_Assistive: It's not possible to save files directly from Power BI visuals, but this dialog will assist you with producing a valid JSON template that you can copy/paste and save elsewhere for others to use.
en-US.New_Spec_Assistive: Select an [empty] template for your preferred provider to begin with a bare-minimum specification, or import an existing template. Some example templates are also available for selection under each provider, if you want a little more assistance in learning how to write a specification.
en-US.Map_Fields_Assistive_Introduction: This dialog allows you to re-map any fields from your dataset that have bindings to an encoding in your specification. You might also be automatically presented with these options if you make a change to the Values data role, such as removing a field that has been bound to your specification, or renaming one. In these cases changes to the dataset may cause downstream issues, so you can use this screen to easily make re-assignments without having to hunt them down.
en-US.Map_Fields_Assistive_Instructions: The fields from your dataset that have a binding to your specification are shown below. Use the dropdown for a particular field to assign a new binding from your dataset. You can also add new fields to the Values data role while this dialog is open and they will become available in the dropdown lists for you to assign.
en-US.Map_Fields_Completion_Instructions: When you've finished, click on the [Apply Mapping] button to re-process your specification with the updated assignment(s).
en-US.Data_Placeholder_Assistive_No_PH: There are no placeholders for this visual. Click the {0} button to begin editing the resulting specification.
en-US.Data_Placeholder_Assistive_PH: Please assign suitable columns or measures from the Values field. It's recommended that you match the data type to the one shown for the template for optimal results. When all items are allocated, click the Create button to begin editing the resulting specification.
en-US.Template_Import_Incorrect_Type: The supplied file is not of type JSON. Please select a valid JSON file and try again.
en-US.Template_Import_Invalid_Json: The supplied file's content did not validate as JSON. Please correct this file, or choose another valid JSON file and try again.
en-US.Template_Import_Not_Deneb: The supplied file's content is not a valid Deneb template. Please correct this file, or choose another valid JSON file and try again.
en-US.Template_Import_None: Use the Select JSON Template button to select and import a template.
en-US.Template_Type_Descriptor_Bool: Template uses a boolean (TRUE/FALSE) value for this dataset field.
en-US.Template_Type_Descriptor_Text: Template uses a text value for this dataset field.
en-US.Template_Type_Descriptor_Numeric: Template uses a numeric value for this dataset field.
en-US.Template_Type_Descriptor_DateTime: Template uses a Date/Time value for this dataset field.
en-US.Template_Type_Descriptor_Other: Template uses an unsupported data type for this dataset field.
en-US.Template_Export_None: Nothing to export at this time.
en-US.Text_Export_Tokenizing: Updating your specification with placeholders for your dataset. Please wait...
en-US.Template_Export_Bad_Spec: Your visual's specification does not compile. Please ensure that this compiles successfully before attempting an export.
en-US.Template_Export_Information_Assistive: Provide the high-level details for your JSON template in this pane.
en-US.Template_Export_Author_Name_Assistive: This is for information purposes (or kudos from your adoring fans!).
en-US.Template_Export_Json_Assistive: Your generated template is shown below. You can go back and refine details and re-generate, or copy it to your clipboard.
en-US.Zoom_Level_Tooltip: Current zoom level in the editor - use the controls to the left to adjust this as necessary
en-US.Current_Provider_Tooltip: This is the provider you are currently using for your specification. The runtime version is also shown here, so that you can ensure that any features of the provider documentation are compatible with the version available in Deneb.
en-US.Pivot_Editor_Preview: Preview Toolbar Debug Mode Pivot Control
en-US.Pivot_Mode_Unknown: Select a debugging mode option from the toolbar.
en-US.Pivot_Dataset_Select_None: Please use the dropdown to select a data set from the generated specification.
en-US.Pivot_Dataset_RowIdentifier: {0}: This represents the (zero-based) index of the internal dataset, and is used for interactivity reconciliation purposes.
en-US.Pivot_Dataset_IdentityName: {0}: Represents the row context for this datum, and is used for interactivity purposes.
en-US.Pivot_Dataset_Unknown: {0}: A field internal to the dataset, generated by Deneb. More can be found out in the documentation.
en-US.Pivot_Dataset_HighlightField: This is the current Cross-Highlight value for [{0}], and provides a way to differentiate from the original (base) value vs. highlighted.
en-US.Pivot_Debug_Error_Placeholder: Please resolve any errors to view this information. More information may be available in the {0} pane.
en-US.Pivot_Debug_Refer_Documentation: Refer to the documentation site for more detail on how this field can be used to assist you.
en-US.Pivot_Debug_SelectedNeutral: "neutral" = the visual has no current selection state and the data point should be displayed normally
en-US.Pivot_Debug_SelectedOn: "on" = the visual has an active selection state and the row is included in the list of selected data points
en-US.Pivot_Debug_SelectedOff: "off" = the visual has an active selection state and the row is excluded from the list of selected data points
en-US.Pivot_Debug_HighlightComparatorEq: "eq" = values are equal to each other
en-US.Pivot_Debug_HighlightComparatorLt: "lt" = Cross-Highlight value is less than original value
en-US.Pivot_Debug_HighlightComparatorGt: "gt" = Cross-Highlight value is greater than original value
en-US.Pivot_Debug_HighlightComparatorNeq: "neq" = values are not equal or directly comparable
en-US.Pivot_Debug_HighlightStatusNeutral: "neutral" = no cross-highlight is applied to the visual
en-US.Pivot_Debug_HighlightStatusOff: "off" = not actively highlighted (but Cross-Highlight is applied)
en-US.Table_Tooltip_TooLong: This is a complex object, or is too large to display.
en-US.Loader_Warning_HoverText: Remote resources cannot be loaded in the AppSource version.
en-US.Loader_Warning_DetailedText: Due to certification requirements, the AppSource version of Deneb does not permit loading from external URLs. This can be done with the standalone version, available from Deneb's GitHub repository. You can learn more about the standalone version on the Getting Started page on Deneb's website (https://deneb-viz.github.io/getting-started#standalone-version).
en-US.Text_Button_Import_File: Click to browse for a valid template file, or drag one here to import it. You can also paste a valid template from the clipboard (either as JSON or as a file).
en-US.Text_Create_Discover_More: Looking for inspiration? You can find more examples at the following locations:
en-US.Text_Create_No_Placeholders: There are no placeholders for this visual. Click the {0} button to begin editing the resulting specification.
en-US.Text_Create_Placeholders: Please assign suitable columns or measures from the Values field. It's recommended that you match the data type to the one shown for the template for optimal results. When all items are allocated, click the {0} button to begin editing the resulting specification.
en-US.Text_Create_Validation_Error: The supplied file is not a valid Deneb template.
en-US.Text_Debug_Error_Config_Parse: There was an issue parsing the Config. Please confirm the Config is valid JSON and free from errors.
en-US.Text_Debug_Error_Spec_Parse: There was an issue parsing the Specification. Please confirm the Specification is valid JSON and free from errors.
en-US.Text_Debug_Data_No_Data: The specified dataset currently has no data to display. If your dataset responds to dynamic events, this will update to show the relevant data when such events occur; otherwise, you can select an alternative datset to view its data.
en-US.Text_Debug_Data_Processing: Selected data set is being processed and formatted for the table. This may take a while for large data sets, but you can continue to use the editor while this is in progress. Please wait...
en-US.Text_Debug_Signal_No_Data: No signal data was found in the Vega view. Please ensure that your specification has parsed correctly and is free of errors.
en-US.Text_Dialog_Body_Version_Change_Subtext: The change log shows what's different between releases.
en-US.Text_Dialog_Body_Version_Increase: There has been an update since you last edited your specification:
en-US.Text_Dialog_Body_Version_Decrease: You're using an older version than this specification was originally authored in. Some features may not be available:
en-US.Text_Dialog_Instruction_Remap: The fields shown to the right have been identified as being in your dataset and have been used in your current specification. For one or more fields, you can use the dropdown next to it to remap it to a different column or measure. When finished, click the {0} button to apply the changes to your current specification.
en-US.Text_Dialog_Notes_Remap: If you have removed or renamed a field from your dataset that is in use, this dialog will be shown automatically. This is to prevent you from having to find all occurrences of the field manually and update them. If you would prefer to do this manually, then you can click on the {0} button to return to the editor.
en-US.Text_Dialog_Overview_Remap: Remap dataset fields that are in use more conveniently than having to hunt them down manually.
en-US.Text_Editor_Status_Bar_Tab_Edit_Tooltip: The [tab] key will indent the selected text. Use [Ctrl+M] or click to switch this behavior to allow you to navigate the interface using the [tab] key.
en-US.Text_Editor_Status_Bar_Tab_Focus_Tooltip: The [tab] key will navigate the interface. Use [Ctrl+M] or click to switch this behavior to allow you to indent the selected text using the [tab] key.
en-US.Text_Landing_Add_Data_Subtitle: At least one column or measure in your visual's dataset is needed for Deneb to function.
en-US.Text_Landing_Add_Data_Body: Add the columns and/or measures you wish to visualize to the Values data role. You can add as many as you wish, in order to achieve the desired 'shape' of your dataset.
en-US.Text_Landing_Create_Visual_Subtitle: Click [...] on the visual header, then 'Edit' to open the advanced editor.
en-US.Text_Landing_Create_Visual_Body: You can import a template, or start with a blank design and build iteratively using your preferred language. You can also add interactivity features to facilitate cross-filtering or highlighting, tooltips and drillthrough.
en-US.Text_Landing_Experience_Visual_Body: When you've finished, you can save your changes, and also export a template of your work to share with others, or add to source control. Return to the report to view and test your design.
en-US.Text_Landing_Resources_Deneb: Read the detailed documentation and see community examples
en-US.Text_Overview_Create: A specification allows you to create a new design using either Vega or Vega-Lite. You can import an existing template, or create a new Vega-Lite or Vega specification.
en-US.Text_Overview_Export_1: You can export a JSON template that you can save elsewhere for others to use.
en-US.Text_Overview_Export_2: A template will include your visual's columns and measure metadata as placeholders for other users. NO DATA IS STORED, although, you may wish to provide more specific names for each field's purpose, as well as a description of its purpose to assist anyone using your template.
en-US.Text_Overview_Export_3: You have the option to include a preview image in your template. This image will be resized to a maximum of {0} by {1} pixels. By checking the box to include a preview image, you acknowledge that you have reviewed the image and you are sure that it is suitable for inclusion into your template. You also acknowledge that if you share this template outside your Power BI tenant or organization, this image may be visible to others.
en-US.Text_Overview_Export_4: Click {0} to save your template to a file. If your tenant admin has disabled downloading from custom visuals, you can also copy the template to your clipboard and paste it into a file or other application for you to save separately.
en-US.Text_No_Template_Selected: No template currently selected - please import a template, or choose from the list of included templates.
en-US.Text_Radio_Button_Description_Cross_Filt: Let Deneb attempt to resolve cross-filtering for me.
I will manage cross-filtering myself in my specification (available for Vega only).
en-US.Text_Remap_In_Progress_Message: Remapping your fields. This can take a few moments for a large specification and the dialog will close when finished. Please wait...
en-US.Text_Remap_State_Tracking: Checking and validating new field paths
en-US.Text_Toast_Body_Unapplied_Changes: These will be lost if you leave the page without applying them.
en-US.Text_Toast_Subtitle_Cross_Filter_Limit_R: Clear your selection to try again.
en-US.Text_Tooltip_Button_Apply: Apply [Ctrl+Enter], or toggle auto / manual mode with [Ctrl+Shift+Enter]
en-US.Text_Tokenizer_Sync_Tooltip: Deneb is currently checking your specification and updating references to your dataset fields for templating and mapping purposes.
en-US.Text_Warning_Invalid_Cross_Filter_Event_: The first parameter must be a valid `event` from the Vega view.
en-US.Text_Warning_Invalid_Cross_Filter_Missin: The second parameter must be a valid filter expression.
en-US.Text_Warning_Invalid_Cross_Filter_Incorr: [pbiCrossFilter] expression functions are valid only for Advanced cross-filtering management mode. Please refer to the documentation for more information.
`options` must be a valid object, and contain valid property values. Refer to the documentation for more information.
en-US.Text_Warning_Invalid_Cross_Filter_Not_Ap: [pbiCrossFilterApply] We were not able to cross-filter data based on your supplied parameters.
